title: Why Do We Remember Emotional Events Better Than Non-emotional Ones? - Neuroscience News
description: Researchers identified a mechanism within the brain that tags information with emotional association for enhanced memory. High-frequency brain waves in the amygdala and hippocampus are critical for enhancing emotional memories.

title: Doctors monitor rise in STDs, including congenital syphilis - KOMO News
description: Doctors have been monitoring a rise in certain sexually transmitted diseases, including syphilis, a bacterial infection that comes with a range of symptoms.

title: Research Shows Gut Bacteria Affect Brain Health – Reveals New Approach to Treating Alzheimer's Disease - SciTechDaily
description: Findings from research on mice suggest a new approach to treating Alzheimer’s and other neurodegenerative diseases. A growing pile of evidence indicates that the tens of trillions of microbes that normally live in our intestines — the so-called gut microbiome…

title: People who had COVID-19 at much greater risk of dying for at least 18 months - msnNOW
description: Risk of death in Covid patients was up to 81-fold higher in the acute phase and five-fold higher in the post-acute phase. The post People who had COVID-19 at much greater risk of dying for at least 18 months appeared first on Talker.
